subject: Gardening
title: Gardens as Mini Ecosystems
description: Learn Gardens as Mini Ecosystems in one minute.

hook.text: Your garden contains more species than most people realize. Even a small plot hosts hundreds of organisms.

buildup.text: Soil bacteria, fungi, insects, worms, birds, and mammals all interact in a garden. It's a complete ecosystem.

discovery.text: One square meter of healthy garden soil contains more living organisms than there are people on Earth.

twist.text: Most gardeners focus on plants. But the invisible majorityâ€”microbes and soil faunaâ€”do the real ecosystem work.

climax.text: Understanding your garden as an ecosystem, not just a collection of plants, changes how you manage everything.

punchline.text: A garden is an ecosystem. Plants are just the visible part.

quiz.question: How many organisms can one square meter of healthy garden soil contain?
options: More than the number of people on Earth
